main event: Multiple sightings of orange-reddish oval-shaped UFO in Centerville, Queen Anne's County, MD on March 22, 1952 at 5:30 PM.
interesting points: The object was described as an orange-yellow pulsating light, traveling at a fast speed, about halfway between the horizon and zenith from west to east, disappearing suddenly without making any sound.
The report mentions that there were many witnesses to the sighting, adding credibility to the event.
Another sighting describes a big silvery gray object that emitted no trails or flashing lights, moving slowly over witnesses' heads and then disappearing suddenly.

One witness reported the object as a dull, orange-yellow, sugar-shaped light, resembling an old-fashioned light bulb, traveling very fast and performing a vertical jumping maneuver similar to a basketball bounce.
The report indicates that the object made a noise like that of a motor, adding an auditory element to the sighting.
